content: REITs Stocks Discussion Investments Savings Asked by AnonymousAsked on 17 Sep 2019How else can we determine if a REIT is a good buy, other than looking at Dividend Yield, Gearing Ratio and how a company is doing?Hi! How do we know if the current REIT price is overvalued and too expensive? How do we tell if a REIT is a good buy at this point? Thanks!1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 17 Sep 2019Consistency of dividends paid out over the years, any funky management decisions (case in point, OUE). As to when is a good time to buy, look at the spread between nav and current price. Find an entry point when the spread is around its lowest.Hope this helps.0 comments1
